str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
Trustworthy, faithful, believing. From peitho; objectively, trustworthy; subjectively, trustful.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: To will, intend, desire, wish. Middle voice of a primary verb; to 'will, ' i.e. be willing.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: To assert emphatically. Middle voice of a compound of dia and bebaioo; to confirm thoroughly, i.e. Asseverate.
This; he, she, it.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To be thoughtful, careful, give heed. From a derivative of phren; to exercise thought, i.e. Be anxious.
From pro and histemi; to stand before, i.e. to preside, or to practise.
Properly, beautiful, but chiefly good, i.e. Valuable or virtuous.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.
This; he, she, it.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Properly, beautiful, but chiefly good, i.e. Valuable or virtuous.
And, even, also, namely.
Profitable, beneficial, useful. From a form of ophelos; helpful or serviceable, i.e. Advantageous.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
